text.p: Shares in National Westminster Bank Plc rose on Wednesday with others in the sector after Credit Lyonnais Laing repeated its positive stance on the stock following a meeting with Natwest.
The shares were up 12p to 671-1/2p by 1010 GMT in a generally firm banking sector.
"We continue to be positive on the whole sector as we have been for two years, but Natwest is statistically the cheapest in the sector," said Martin Hughes, banking analyst at Credit Lyonnais Laing.
Barclays was up 7-1/2p at 910p, Abbey National rose 5-1/2p to 585p and HSBC added 16-1/2p to 11.18 stg.
Natwest has underperformed the rest of the sector by around seven percent this year.
"Following a meeting with Natwest, we are reiterating our bullish view and confirming our forecasts," Hughes said.
